title.narrative: IMPROVED QUALITY AND MANAGEMENT OF CHILD PROTECTION SERVICES

description.narrative: Improved cross-sectoral coordination and public services, at national and subnational levels, to benefit child witnesses, victims and perpetrators., which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Education â€“ General, Evaluation, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, Brazil's child protection system strengthened in its capacity to prevent and respond to violence against children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved cross-sectoral coordination and public services, at national and subnational levels, to benefit child witnesses,victims and perpetrators.

description.narrative: UNICEF launched the new cycle of UNICEF Seal (2021-2024), with Child Protection presenting its goals in a session visualized over 6,000 times. UNICEF also concluded the pilot interventions for armed violence impact reduction in Recife, São Luís and Rio de Janeiro, reaching 2,076 children and adolescents with mobilization, capacity-building, and service-delivery actions. The lessons learned from these interventions will be incorporated in the new Urban Centers strategies, designed by Child Protection, with a view to escalating UNICEF’s reach and creating opportunities to transform most vulnerable urban territories to protect adolescents and youth from violence. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2022
